snippet: The automaker told investors and analysts that it would cut costs and expand its China operations, emphasizing growth and financial results.
abstract: General Motors chief executive Mary T Barra and her top aides outline strategies in presentation to investors and analysts for increasing profits, part of company's attempt to move beyond its safety crisis; even as GM has pushed its agenda beyond recalls it has issued, company still faces several legal challenges and investigations related to defective vehicles.

byline.contributor: Hilary Stout, Rebecca R. Ruiz and Ben Protess contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The automaker told investors and analysts that it would cut costs and expand its China operations, emphasizing growth and financial results.

headline.main: G.M. Details Plan to Increase Profits
headline.print_headline: G.M. Details Plan to Increase Profits
